title: Jayson Tatum won’t make return from Achilles tear in Celtics’ matchup vs. 76ers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jayson Tatum will not return for the Celtics' game against the 76ers as he recovers from an Achilles injury.
Celtics' Baylor Scheierman is questionable with a thumb fracture; 76ers' Joel Embiid is out with an oblique strain.
The Celtics are second in the East with an 8-2 record in the last ten games, facing 76ers who've beaten them twice this season.

title: Jarren Duran’s hot start to spring training continues, hitting 2 homers vs. Twins. What could it mean for Red Sox’ lineup?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jarren Duran hits two home runs in a spring training game against the Twins, bringing his total to three.
Duran struggles traditionally against left-handed pitchers, holding a .232 career average and .620 OPS against them.
Despite offseason trade rumors, Duran remains with the Red Sox, potentially slated for the designated hitter role in 2026.

title: As 2025-26 Bruins exceed expectations, so has their prospect pool in college hockey
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston College forwards James Hagens and Dean Letourneau have scored a combined 39 goals this hockey season.
Seven Bruins prospects participated in the Agganis Arena rivalry game, where Boston University defeated Boston College 3-1.
The Bruins' 2025-26 season success is bolstered by strong performances from prospects like Hagens and Letourneau in college hockey.

title: Celtics ‘clear pick’ to win the East? One NBA assistant coach reportedly feels that way
author: Conor Roche
bullets: An NBA assistant coach predicts the Boston Celtics as the clear favorite to win the Eastern Conference.
The Celtics are currently 5.5 games behind the Detroit Pistons, sitting in second place in the Eastern Conference.
Boston's strong performance with a league-leading 9.9 net rating since Thanksgiving supports confidence in their playoff prospects.

title: Review and setlist: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit bring a well-rounded Americana showcase to Boston
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit performed a varied setlist at the Boch Center Wang Theatre on February 27, 2026.
The performance featured a mix of Isbell's solo and band work, including tracks from his Drive-By Truckers days.
Isbell showcased his range with hits like 'Cover Me Up' and covers like The Rolling Stones' 'Can't You Hear Me Knocking.'

title: Latest reports suggest Patriots are unlikely to land big-name edge rusher before NFL Draft
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots unlikely to acquire top edge rushers like Maxx Crosby, Trey Hendrickson, or Jaelan Phillips before the NFL Draft.
Patriots face financial constraints in free agency with $40 million cap space, affecting pursuit of premier pass rushers.
Zion Young, Missouri edge rusher, emerges as potential Patriots draft target with strong pressures and quarterback hits.

title: What Paramount’s pending purchase of Warner Bros. Discovery means for sports fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Paramount Skydance to acquire Warner Bros. Discovery for $110 billion, pending regulatory approval.
CBS and TNT/TBS may integrate due to the acquisition, affecting NCAA, MLB, and NHL broadcasts.
NFL exploring more streaming partnerships; Netflix retains exclusive rights to Christmas Day games.

title: Patriots reportedly interested in A.J. Brown, but not at Eagles’ current asking price
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots interested in trading for A.J. Brown, but Eagles' current asking price deemed too high.
Eagles' potential trade of Brown before June 1 could result in $44 million in dead money.
New England exploring keeping Stefon Diggs and acquiring A.J. Brown, requiring potential contract restructuring.

title: Bye-bye transponders: E-ZPass switching to stickers
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts will transition from hard-plastic E-ZPass transponders to RFID-equipped windshield sticker tags starting Sunday.
The new sticker tags are provided free and are estimated to save the state $7.4 million annually.
Existing E-ZPass transponders will remain functional, and the switch aims to reduce production costs significantly.

title: Woburn man charged with evading $1.2 million in income tax
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Jean Brito of Woburn pleaded not guilty to 10 charges, including tax evasion and filing false tax returns.
Between 2018 and 2023, Brito allegedly underreported $20 million in business income and evaded $1.2 million in taxes.
State Police and FBI agents seized $35,000 in cash and documents from Brito's home and business premises.
